item.title: WWE And Netflix Games Tag Team To Bring WWE 2K To Mobile
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wwe-and-netflix-games-tag-team-to-bring-wwe-2k-to-mobile/1100-6529143/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Earlier this month, WWE Raw--the weekly flagship show for the largest professional wrestling company in the world--made the switch from traditional TV to weekly streaming on Netflix. Today, the two companies announced the next chapter in their partnership, which will see the WWE 2K video game franchise come to mobile devices via the Netflix Games service later this year.

The announcement came via a brief teaser video featuring WWE Superstar CM Punk. No footage or additional details on the mobile version were provided--only that “WWE 2K games” would be coming to the service in “Fall 2025.”

This has been a busy week for the WWE 2K franchise, which also revealed Roman Reigns as the cover athlete for WWE 2K25 on consoles and PC. This latest iteration of the annual wrestling simulation will offer over 300 wrestlers and add new features like intergender matches, a new hub world called The Island, and more.

Netflix Games, meanwhile, now offers over 100 games free of charge to all subscribed members via its mobile app. Recent additions include Monument Valley 3, Squid Game Unleashed, Sonic Mania Plus, and another 2K offering in Sid Meier’s Civilization VI.

WWE 2K will hit the Netflix Games service this fall. WWE 2K25 launches on March 14, though those who preorder the premium Deadman Edition or Bloodline Edition can access the game one week early on March 7.

Jason Fanelli on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Action RPG Project F4E Is Now Vaultbreakers, Beta Test Starts Very Soon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/action-rpg-project-f4e-is-now-vaultbreakers-beta-test-starts-very-soon/1100-6529134/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Developer BetaDwarf has announced its newest game, Vaultbreakers. Previously known under the codename "Project F4E," Vaultbreakers is described by its developer as a "hardcore top-down PvPvE ARPG," and select players will be able to access a closed playtest at the end of the week.

"The game is set in an evolving world that challenges players to think tactically, adapt dynamically, and battle fiercely," game director and BetaDwarf CEO Steffen Kabbelgaard said in a press release announcing the game. "With unpredictable events triggered by Changelings or other players, and with a focus on player skill and knowledge, I believe we are offering a fresh new multiplayer ARPG experience."

BetaDwarf also shared a reveal trailer, which shows Vaultbreakers' gameplay along with a cinematic animation. In it, two players are shown battling a pair of enemies. One player falls, while the other escapes through a portal, which serves as the game's extraction point.

"Many of us in the team love the extraction game's mechanics, but all of them are currently shooters," lead game designer Nikolaj Wendt said of the choice to blend extraction with a top-down ARPG. "Unfortunately, we are also very bad at shooters, but there wasn’t any alternative on the market, so we decided to make our own!”

A closed Vaultbreakers playtest encompassing the first and second chapters of the game's narrative campaign will begin on January 31. Players who want to get their hands on the current build can request access via Steam or the official Vaultbreakers website. Access keys will also be available through Twitch Drops from select content creators, and according to BetaDwarf, playtest participants will also earn Legacy Points, an in-game currency players can use to unlock rewards that will carry over to the game's final build when it officially launches.

Vaultbreakers' official release date has not yet been announced, but it's currently available to wishlist on Steam.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
